utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, nice to meet you I, I've been having just over the last week my cough that's been getting worse and I had a fever a couple of nights and just yesterday I noticed that I started having a loss of taste and smell so that got me really worried.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so yeah, let's rewind a little bit. The cough you said started a couple of weeks ago, so would that be about 2 weeks? Three weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I would say last week, so like 7 seven days ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Seven days ago, OK. So that started seven days ago and then when did the fever start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The fever I hasn't been constant, but I've like had some nights where I just feel really chilly and then during the day sometimes even getting these chills I've been recorded at a temperature, but I think I've had a fever at least three times in the last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so you haven't actually taken your temperature, but it you just feel like you have chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, we could take your temperature today. And then the loss of smell and taste. Do they both happen at the same time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think the taste happened like before, but that was just yesterday and then yesterday morning like at breakfast, I couldn't really taste anything and then continued during lunch and dinner, but smell, I kind of lost around the evening.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, all just started yesterday.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um alright, so let's go back to the cough and has it been constant since it started?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's been pretty constant. It's been getting worse, especially like in the last few days. I'm mainly coughing like before I was coughing mainly at night, but now I'm coughing throughout the day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um so yeah, you mentioned possibly a trigger would be like time of day at night? Or did you notice any other triggers like you know, the cold air or dust or anything at home that could be potentially triggering your cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, not really. Like I've lived in the same place for awhile, no new changes and I've been barely going outside, so I don't think there are any triggers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and in terms of the quality of your cough is that, would you say it's harsh? Barky?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I would just say it's like kind of harsh at times, but mainly it's a dry cough, like I'm not bringing anything up.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. And then you said dry cough so no sputum or blood right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you ever experienced anything like this in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not the loss of taste and smell, but like the other stuff when I just had a cold or flu like symptoms previously, but the taste and smell is something completely new.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And then, um, have you experienced any shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, not really, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. How about we wheeziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uh, experienced any weight loss recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have been a bit tired in the last few days. The fevers at night and morning. Just feeling a little bit crummy, just not really energetic, energetic to do anything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just been planner, just sitting on the couch.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any changes to your hair, nails, or skin, like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, you mentioned loss of smell. Do you have a runny nose or a stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I did have a runny nose earlier this week, but that's kind of subsided. Other than that, I don't really feel too much congestion. I've been taking Tylenol, the Tylenol cold so I don't know if that helped.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how often are you taking the Tylenol cold?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just took it like for four days just before going to sleep in the last week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, I see. OK. OK and then. Any I do have a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, ok. How about any changes to your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any pain or discharge in the eyes or ears?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you ever feel like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And any swelling in your limbs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I can tell.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes in your bowel habits like constant constipation or diarrhea.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, not really.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, no blood in the stool, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any changes to your appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, just maybe in like a little bit with the loss of smell and taste, the food is not really the same in the last day, last few days?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah yeah, that makes sense. Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. And any changes in terms of urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been peeing alright.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good. Any major or a longstanding medical conditions, or are you otherwise healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I've been fortunate otherwise healthy. I had asthma as a kid, but like I haven't had to use the puffers for more than a decade.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh ok. OK. And what triggers your asthma?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think back then it was just when I did sports and I was running around a lot. I've been fine for the last 10 years at least.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, that's good. And any surgeries or hospitalizations in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Any are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Currently just the other thing, Tylenol cold, but other than that no other medications.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, not even other over the counter medications or herbal supplements?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, sometimes in the fall like I get a bit sniffly and, but other than that, I don't know of any allergies to any foods or medications.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how about immunizations? Are you up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, they're all up to date.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any lung conditions or heart conditions that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, my father did recently have a heart attack at age of 58 I think he was, he, he's fine though, but that's that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any cancers that run in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And, and do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, yeah I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how much do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Probably, I would say a pack a day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Pack a day, OK. For how long?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah, probably since in my 20s, so at least 10 years now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, have you ever thought about cutting down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, especially with this pandemic going on, it's been, I've been trying to cut down just because like I don't want to get the, get COVID and then you know my lungs are probably already weaker because of the smoking. So I've been trying to cut down.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure it's good that you're trying to cut down. We have resources to help you if you ever need them.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you do marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, I've never tried marijuana.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, um, besides alcohol, nothing else.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and then um, I guess I'll ask you about the alcohol, uhm, how much do you drink?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, um, not that much. I'd probably say like a few times a week when there's a game on. I just grab a couple of beers, but that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, and where do you live right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I just live just outside of London with my wife and daughter in a small townhouse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and anyone else at home sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. I I've kind of stayed away once I noticed some symptoms. I'm just kind of just staying in my room, not getting out. I don't wanna make any of my families like.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, that makes sense. And have you traveled to anywhere recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, umm, I haven't really traveled. I do I do go to work though I haven't in the last last week. I've told them that I've been having these symptoms, but other than that, no traveling.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Uhm, OK, that's good. Those were all the questions I had for you today. Was there anything that you wanted to ask me or anything else that you wanted to discuss that I may have missed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, yeah, I I that I'm just wondering like I could it be COVID I I don't know. I don't know if someone in the office had it or yeah, it was just basically worried about, if I had COVID.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure. that's definitely something that we need to rule out, so we will be doing a COVID swab on you and and you will hear back in about 24 to 48 hours with the results. But regardless, because your symptoms overlap with symptoms of COVID especially umm, the loss of smell and taste, we do recommend that you isolate for 14 days and that includes trying to isolate from family members as well. So we'll, that's where we'll start. If it's not COVID, it could be another viral illness that's going around at this time of year. But, we'll start with, we'll start with these COVID swabs. How does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, that sounds good. I'll, I'll let my work know and yeah, hopefully it comes back negative, but I'll stay away from everyone till then.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, sounds great, thank you.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
